sen.j: 岩倉駅（いわくらえき）は、京都市左京区にある叡山電鉄叡山電鉄鞍馬線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in the Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City, the Iwakura Station is a stop on the Kurama Line, the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, Iwakura Station is a stop on the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Located in the Sakyo ward of Kyoto City, Iwakura Station is a stop on the Kurama Line of the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ。
sen.e: The station has two platforms serving two tracks which face each other.
The station has two platforms serving two tracks that face each other.
The station has two platforms serving two tracks that face each other.

sen.j: それぞれのホームに出入り口があり、スロープも備えている。
sen.e: Each platform has an entrance and a ramp.
Each platform has an entrance and a ramp.
Each platform has an entrance and a ramp.

sen.j: 無人駅であるが出町柳駅行きホームには自動券売機とトイレがある。
sen.e: The station is an unmanned station with vending machines and a toilet installed on the Demachiyanagi Station-bound platform.
The station is an unmanned station with vending machines and a toilet installed on the Demachiyanagi Station-bound platform.
The station is an unmanned station with ticket vending machines and a toilet installed on the Demachiyanagi Station-bound platform.

sen.j: 自動券売機は平日の7時から17時まで、土曜・休日の9時から17時まで稼動するほか、平日の7時から9時までのみ定期券の予約受付のため駅員が配置される。
sen.e: The vending machines are available from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. on weekdays and from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Saturday and holidays, while the station staff is at work only from 7 to 9 a.m. on weekdays to accept reservation of commuter passes.

The vending machines are in operation from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. on weekdays and from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Saturdays and holidays, while the station staff is at work only from 7 a.m. to 9 a.m. on weekdays to accept reservations of commuter passes.

The ticket vending machines are in operation from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. on weekdays and from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Saturdays and holidays, while the station staff is at work only from 7 a.m. to 9 a.m. on weekdays to accept reservations of commuter passes.

sen.j: ホームのほぼ全体を上屋が覆っている。
sen.e: The roofs cover almost the entire platforms.
The roofs cover almost the entire platforms.
The roofs cover almost the entirety of the platforms.

sen.j: 両ホームは駅の出町柳駅側の府道踏切で連絡する。
sen.e: Two platforms are accessed by a level crossing on the Prefecture Road on the Demachiyanagi Station side.
Two platforms are accessed by a level crossing on the Prefecture Road, on the Demachiyanagi Station side.
Two platforms are accessed by a level crossing on the Prefectural Route, on the Demachiyanagi Station side.

sen.j: 以前は他の駅と同様に府道の踏切から階段で出入する構造であったが、2006年の隣接地への京都市岩倉地域包括支援センター開設に伴うバリアフリー化のために現在の構造に改築された。
sen.e: Previously, the platforms were accessed by stairs from the level crossing on the Prefecture Road like other stations, but the station adopted the current barrier-free design when the Kyoto City Iwakura District Support Center opened on the adjacent area in 2006.

Previously, the platforms were accessed by stairs from the level crossing on the Prefecture Road, as with other stations, but the station adopted the current barrier-free design in 2006 when the Kyoto City Iwakura District Support Center opened in the adjacent area.

Previously, the platforms were accessed by stairs from the level crossing on the Prefectural Route, as with other stations, but the station adopted the current barrier-free design in 2006 when the Kyoto City Iwakura District Support Center opened in the adjacent area.

sen.j: 住宅街にあり（岩倉地区は市街化調整区域のため、高層マンションなどの大規模開発は出来ず、一戸建て住宅と低層集合住宅が中心となっている）、京都府道106号神山岩倉停車場線に面している。
sen.e: The station is located in the residential area (since a large-scale development including high-rise apartment buildings is prohibited in the Iwakura District, an urbanization control area, independent houses and low-rise apartment buildings are the major construction), and faces the Kouyama-iwakura Teisyajosen Kyoto Fudo 106 Go (Kyoto Prefecture Road 106).

The station is located in a residential area (because large-scale development, including high-rise apartment buildings, is prohibited in the Iwakura District, an urbanization control area, independent houses and low-rise apartment buildings are the major construction), and faces the Kouyama-iwakura Teisyajosen Kyoto Fudo 106 Go (Kyoto Prefecture Road 106).

The station is located in a residential area (because large-scale development, including high-rise apartment buildings, is prohibited in the Iwakura District, an urbanization control area, independent houses and low-rise apartment buildings are the major construction), and faces the Koyama-Iwakura Teishajo Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 106.
sen.cmt: 京都府道106号神山岩倉停車場線→Koyama-Iwakura Teishajo Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 106

sen.j: 1キロ弱の距離があるが京都市営地下鉄烏丸線国際会館駅へも徒歩で行けるため、出口には「地下鉄国際会館駅方面」の案内表示がある。
sen.e: From the station to the Karasuma-Sen (Karasuma Line), Kyoto City Subway Kokusaikaikan Station is about 1 km away, and is accessible on foot, and thus, there is a guide "To Subway Kokusaikaikan Station" at the exit.

From the station to the Karasuma-Sen (Karasuma Line), Kyoto City Subway Kokusai-kaikan Station is about 1 km away, and is accessible on foot; thus there is a guide "To Subway Kokusai-kaikan Station" at the exit.

It is a distance of about 1 km the station to the Kokusaikaikan Station on the Karasuma Line of the Kyoto Municipal Subway, and it's accessible on foot; thus there is a guide 'To Subway Kokusai-kaikan Station' at the exit.
sen.cmt: 京都市営地下鉄→Kyoto Municipal Subway

sen.j: 京都市立洛北中学校
sen.e: Rakuhoku Junior High School
Rakuhoku Junior High School
Kyoto Municipal Rakuhoku Junior High School
sen.cmt: 既出記事と統一し、kyoto municipal追加しました。

sen.j: 岩倉川
sen.e: Iwakura River
Iwakura River
Iwakura River

sen.j: 大垣書店岩倉店
sen.e: Ogaki books (Ogaki-shoten) Iwakura Branch (Iwakura-ten)
Ogaki Books (Ogaki-shoten) Iwakura Branch (Iwakura-ten)
Ogaki Books (Ogaki Shoten), Iwakura Branch

sen.j: 京都岩倉郵便局
sen.e: Kyoto Iwakura Post Office
Kyoto Iwakura Post Office
Kyoto Iwakura Post Office

sen.j: 実相院
sen.e: Jissoin Temple
Jissoin Temple
Jissoin Temple

sen.j: 京都市岩倉地域包括支援センター
sen.e: Kyoto City Iwakura District Support Center
Kyoto City Iwakura District Support Center
Kyoto City Iwakura District Support Center

sen.j: バスのりば
sen.e: Bus stop
Bus stop
Bus stop

sen.j: 岩倉駅前
sen.e: Iwakuraekimae
Iwakuraekimae
Iwakura-eki-mae (Iwakura Station)
sen.cmt: ハイフンを入れ、英訳を追加。

sen.j: （駅から北へ300メートルほどの府道との交差点付近）
sen.e: (Near the intersection at the Prefecture Road which is 300 meters to the north of the station.)
(Near the intersection at the Prefecture Road, which is 300 meters to the north of the station.)
(Near the intersection at the Prefectural Route, which is 300 meters to the north of the station.)

sen.j: 京都バス
sen.e: Kyoto Bus
Kyoto Bus
Kyoto Bus

sen.j: 岩倉実相院、岩倉村松、国際会館駅、北大路駅、出町柳駅、四条河原町、京都駅方面 （同一行先でも系統により乗場が異なるので注意）
sen.e: Bound for Jissoin Temple, Iwakura Muramatsu, Kokusaikaikan Station, Kitaoji Station, Demachiyanagi Station, Shijo-Kawaramachi, and Kyoto Station
Bound for Jissoin Temple, Iwakura Muramatsu, Kokusai-kaikan Station, Kitaoji Station, Demachiyanagi Station, Shijo-Kawaramachi and Kyoto Station

Bound for Jissoin Temple, Iwakura Muramatsu, Kokusai-kaikan Station, Kitaoji Station, Demachiyanagi Station, Shijo-Kawaramachi and Kyoto Station (even if the destination is the same, boarding stations differ according to routes, therefore attention should be paid)

sen.j: 戦後、1958年から32年間にわたって複線区間の末端であったため、当駅折り返しの列車が多く設定されていた。
sen.e: After the World War II, the station served as the end of the double-track section for 32 years from 1958, and thus, many shuttle trains arriving at and returning from the station were operated.
sen.cmt: 「戦後」は「第二次世界大戦後」と訳しました。
sen.e: After World War II, the station served as the end of the double-track section for 32 years beginning in 1958, so many shuttle trains were in operation, arriving at and returning from the station.
After World War II, the station served as the end of the double-track section for 32 years beginning in 1958, so many shuttle trains were in operation, arriving at and returning from the station.

sen.j: 二軒茶屋駅まで複線区間が延伸されたため、現在は折り返し列車の設定はない。
sen.e: Since the double-track section was extended to the Nikenchaya Station, no shuttle train has been operated.
No shuttle train has operated since the double-track section was extended to Nikenchaya Station.
No shuttle train has operated since the double-track section was extended to Nikenchaya Station.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）12月1日 鞍馬電気鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: The station opened on December 1, 1928, as a station owned by the Kurama Electric Railway.
The station opened on December 1, 1928 under the ownership of the Kurama Electric Railway.
December 1, 1928: The station opened under the ownership of the Kurama Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）8月1日 会社合併により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On August 1, 1942, the station came to be owned by the Keifuku Electric Railroad as a result of amalgamation.
On August 1, 1942 the station came under the ownership of the Keifuku Electric Railroad due to the amalgamation.
August 1, 1942: The station came under the ownership of the Keifuku Electric Railroad due to the amalgamation.

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）11月10日 当駅を含む、山端（現・宝ヶ池駅）～二軒茶屋駅 (京都府)間が、戦争に伴う資材供出のため単線化。
sen.e: On November 10, 1944, the line between the Yamabana Station (currently called Takaragaike Station) and the Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), including the Iwakura Station, became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

On November 10, 1944 the line between Yamabana Station (currently Takaragaike Station) and Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), including Iwakura Station, became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

November 10, 1944: The line between Yamabana Station (currently Takaragaike Station) and Nikenchaya Station (Kyoto Prefecture), including Iwakura Station, became a single track for the delivery of supplies for the war.

sen.j: 1958年（昭和33年）4月9日 宝ヶ池～当駅間が再複線化。
sen.e: On April 9, 1958, the line between the Takaragaike Station and the Iwakura Station became a double track again.
On April 9, 1958 the line between Takaragaike Station and Iwakura Station became a double track again.
April 9, 1958: The line between Takaragaike Station and Iwakura Station became a double track again.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 会社再編により叡山電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1986, the station came to be owned by the Eizan Electric Railway as a result of reorganization of companies.
On April 1, 1986 the station came under the ownership of the Eizan Electric Railway due to the reorganization of companies.
April 1, 1986: The station came under the ownership of the Eizan Electric Railway due to the reorganization of companies.

sen.j: 1990年（平成2年）9月28日 当駅～二軒茶屋駅間が再複線化。
sen.e: On September 28, 1990, the line between the Iwakura Station and the Nikenchaya Station became a double track again.
On September 28, 1990 the line between Iwakura Station and Nikenchaya Station became a double track again.
September 28, 1990: The line between Iwakura Station and Nikenchaya Station became a double track again.

sen.j: 2006年（平成18年）4月1日 隣接地に京都市岩倉地域包括支援センターが開設。
sen.e: On April 1, 2006, the Kyoto City Iwakura District Support Center opened at the adjacent area.
On April 1, 2006 the Kyoto City Iwakura District Support Center opened in the adjacent area.
April 1, 2006: The Kyoto City Iwakura District Support Center opened in the adjacent area.

sen.j: これまでにバリアフリー化のために現在の構造に改築。
sen.e: The station has been remodeled to the current construction to adopt barrier-free design.

sen.j: 叡山電鉄

sen.e: Kurama Line

sen.e: Hachimanmae Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Iwakura Station - Kino Station
